attributes.action: zero hours contract and tax credits
attributes.additional_details: It is time that the Tax Credit rules were changed in order to help those on zero-hours contracts have a decent standard of living. I would like to see the rules on the tax credits made fair to those on this ad-hoc basis of working because under the current system they are only assuming that everyone is getting a guaranteed 30hours a week, but this isn't the case as more companies are using zero-hours contracts to cut wage bills. I would like to see a qualifying minimum hours set at 15 hours a week regardless of your circumstances single/married etc.
